summary: "Requiem for a Dream" is a powerful 2000 drama film about four people struggling with drug addiction. Based on Hubert Selby Jr.'s novel, the movie shows how addiction takes over their lives, leading to a world of fantasy and despair. Director Darren Aronofsky and Selby worked together on the script. Despite initial funding challenges, the film was shot in Brooklyn and received critical acclaim for its intense portrayal of addiction, with Ellen Burstyn's performance earning Oscar and Golden Globe nominations. Though it didn't make much money, the film's emotional impact and powerful themes have made it a notable work in cinema.
title: Requiem for a Dream
